michelle.goal: Provide your available time slots on Monday that can accommodate the required meeting duration.

steven.goal: Provide your available time slots on Monday that can accommodate the required meeting duration.

jerry.goal: Provide your available time slots on Monday that can accommodate the required meeting duration.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate participant availabilities and produce a PDDL domain and problem targeting the FastDownwards solver that encodes scheduling a meeting that fits all participants' calendars.

public_information: Schedule a one hour meeting on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00
All participants must attend the same continuous one hour slot
Time granularity is 30 minutes and a solution exists with current calendars

availability.system_prompt: You are Michelle. Use your private calendar busy periods and the public information about meeting duration and work hours to compute your available one-hour slots on Monday. Return a concise structured representation such as a list of available start-end time ranges in HH:MM-HH:MM format. Do not emit PDDL.
availability.prompt: Agent michelle. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private information: {agents->michelle->private_information}. Your goal: {agents->michelle->goal}. Compute and return your available time ranges that can fit the required meeting duration.

availability.system_prompt: You are Steven. Use your private calendar busy periods and the public information about meeting duration and work hours to compute your available one-hour slots on Monday. Return a concise structured representation such as a list of available start-end time ranges in HH:MM-HH:MM format. Do not emit PDDL.
availability.prompt: Agent steven. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private information: {agents->steven->private_information}. Your goal: {agents->steven->goal}. Compute and return your available time ranges that can fit the required meeting duration.

availability.system_prompt: You are Jerry. Use your private calendar busy periods and the public information about meeting duration and work hours to compute your available one-hour slots on Monday. Return a concise structured representation such as a list of available start-end time ranges in HH:MM-HH:MM format. Do not emit PDDL.
availability.prompt: Agent jerry. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private information: {agents->jerry->private_information}. Your goal: {agents->jerry->goal}. Compute and return your available time ranges that can fit the required meeting duration.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator for scheduling. You will receive structured availability outputs from each participant. Your task is to integrate these availabilities and produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that encode scheduling a single continuous one-hour meeting attended by all participants within the given work hours. The produced PDDL must be compatible with the FastDownwards solver. Provide the PDDL domain enclosed between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem enclosed between <problem></problem> tags. Keep participant actions and objects distinct and do not modify participants' reported availabilities.
pddl.prompt: Orchestrator. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Here is Michelle availability: {avail_michelle}. Here is Steven availability: {avail_steven}. Here is Jerry availability: {avail_jerry}. Integrate these availabilities to find feasible meeting start times, then produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem targeting FastDownwards that represent the scheduling problem. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
